name: Kepler-351
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-351 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-351 is a star with 0.7450000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.85 times its radius. It is located 3645.93 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-351 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-351 b

Kepler-351 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 37.05 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-351.

The mass of Kepler-351 b is 14.09 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-351 b is 3.06 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-351 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-351 c

Kepler-351 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 57.25 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-351.

The mass of Kepler-351 c is 15.62 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-351 c is 3.19 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-351 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-351, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
